articles.title: Rudy Giuliani pleads not guilty in Georgia election case, won't attend arraignment hearing
articles.description: Rudy Giuliani on Friday pleaded not guilty to Georgia charges that accuse him of trying, along with former President Donald Trump and others, to illegally overturn the results of the 2020 election in the state.In filing his not guilty plea with the court, the former New York mayor and Trump attorney also waived his right to appear at an arraignment hearing set for Sept.
articles.content:
Rudy Giuliani on Friday pleaded not guilty to Georgia charges that accuse him of trying, along with former President Donald Trump and others, to illegally overturn the results of the 2020 election in the state.

articles.description: Though Missouri’s 2024 primary election is still 11 months away and the names that will appear on the ballot are still in question, several secretaries of state are reviewing former President Donald Trump’s eligibility to appear on the ballot.

articles.title: Capitol Rioter Screams 'Trump Won' After Judge Gives Him 10 Years in Prison
articles.description: The Proud Boy tearfully told a judge he had "given up politics" before the sentence was handed down.
articles.content:
A member of the Proud Boys yelled "Trump won" in front of his wife and child after a Washington, D.C., judge sentenced him to 10 years in prison for his role in the January 6, 2021, sacking of the U.S. Capitol.

articles.title: Record Number of Families Cross Southern Border Illegally in August
articles.description: The roughly 91,000 migrants who were arrested after crossing together as families exceeded a record set in May 2019, the height of the border crisis during the Trump administration.

articles.title: Proud Boy claims ‘Trump won’ after sobbing for mercy and receiving 10-year sentence: reports
articles.description: Proud Boy Dominic Pezzola sobbed in a Washington, D.C., courtroom Friday as he asked a federal judge for leniency in his Jan. 6 sentence and vowed to stay out of politics in the future. articles.title: What Trump thinks of Mitch McConnell's potential replacements
articles.description: It would be a mistake to presuppose these are the final days of Sen. Mitch McConnell’s record-setting run as the Republican leader in the Senate. But his recent public freezing spells make it imprudent not to consider what comes next.

articles.author: POLITICO
articles.title: The 14th Amendment theory that could define 2024: Is Trump eligible to run?
articles.description: Some scholars say Trump is disqualified under the 14th Amendment’s insurrection clause. Here’s how the courts might wade in.
articles.content: The other, more politically perilous option would be for one or more states to embrace the theory outright and simply refuse to list Trump on their ballots. That might force Trump to file his own lawsuits asking courts to order his candidacy restored... [7611 chars]
